It should be noted that Fitz and I were up 3-0 in 'water' pong before switching sides, then lost 4 straight to intoxicated Kass-DiBuccio combination. My favorite lolol

comments.author: wwecoowner

comments.author: wwecoowner
comments.text: thanks for the kind words! i think we all live, or try to live fulfilling lives but some of the good gets lost... writing it down and then posting it as some 'accomplishment' really makes it more important to me and i hope for those involved. and yes, tennis in 2016 will likely have its own entry next january hahaha

comments.author: (Anonymous)
comments.text: *haha* I've actually discussed "Toxic" several times recently, that I haven't sung it in ages and ought to reprise it... I can still reach all the notes!

comments.author: (Anonymous)
comments.text: So this begs the question... when is the next karaoke gathering?!

comments.author: Di
comments.text: Just the other day I heard "faster stronger" or whatever its called by Kanye and I literally said to myself "THIS WAS THE DODGEBALL 110 THEME SONG"..hahaha BUT then I said holy heck in a few months it'll be DB 200. Anytime I hear "Green light" I think of you and Mel. Anytime I hear the ONE metallica song I know I think of Bobbys entrance from db and also Megill saying "is this metallica?!". Anytime I hear the song Ryan and I get saying "woo, wooo, wooo" from Sheraton karaoke I think of that time. When I hear Taio cruz 'dynomite' I think of my cousins wedding that you attended...the list goes on and on.... It's great to have music be a way to remember certain things. Sometimes I wonder if certain songs that my mom hears, brings back times, even good/bad.

comments.author: Mari
comments.text: Black eyed peas- time ;)

comments.author: ME
comments.text: Very kind Mr. John Tronolone

comments.author: CAdams
comments.text: Undertaker Theme Music. Ok, ok... if I were to choose a song, it would be "Saturdays" by Chevelle. Yes, I introduced you to this song, but you used it as the theme song for Dodgeball #XX (your job to remember, not mine). And the lyrics "We all belong in the Saturdays of our youth" has always reminded me of playing dodgeball, and will continue to remind me of it for the rest of my life.

comments.author: (Anonymous)
comments.text: I like how you write in code.... so much undecipherable to those not involved! But I guess that's the point, ain't it? Grapes, blueberries and apples. You're a farmer. Alright, color me confused, haha. Nov. 26th, 2006, was that the day I think it is? And a few days later we were at DD talking about it? Then SURVIVOR SERIES shortly thereafter?! It's hard to hear the bumpy road with your mama was over three years ago. I remember that pretty vividly (not compared to your memory of course). Where will we be in another three or four years? Ah, who knows, probably jumping out of another plane somewhere... haha. -Demolition Crush -Demolition Smash -Demolition Axe

comments.author: Jim Butler
comments.text: Flip the D in the Double-D and you get the sun, the circle of life! Now THAT'S sexy to every body! haha! I saw you on a billboard. I saw you in a newspaper. Where will I see you next? And wow, was that commercial awesome! The One Key (Mon-Key) along with the All Seeing eye/Mon-Star (one star), the DROID, and the hamburgler/freddy kruger/jupiter/tiger/checkerboard of duality traveling to all the places we love, the Vagus nerve, the sacred femin9 (statue of liberty), etc. Amazing archetypes displayed there! After all, these same themes keep coming up, right? Love, parents, the h[ero's]-LOVE journey (which now includes the pitfalls of college and jobs!), it's all very interesting to read about every1's journey through their eyes!

comments.author: Bojana Beric
comments.text: John, I wish you only happiness and prosperity in life!

comments.author: Dips (Diana)
comments.text: As per my yearly tradition, I always tend to wait a few days to re-read this and finally comment. (I also forgot this yr. lol) Anywayyy.. I don't really look at this so much as a time line, but more so figuratively speaking, as a history book. Just like a history book back in the old days, the only thing highlighted were things that we had to remember. This John, is just another chapter in a verrryy long history book, that will continue to be highlighted throughout the years. I can only look forward in being part of it for many more years. Here's to 2010! Dips - I still won't forgive you for being my curse for all my favorite sports teams. LOL.

comments.author: C. Adams
comments.text: Nice entry! Always an entertaining read, Jawn. You didn't mention me enough, so fuck you (haha), but aside from that, sweet recap on the year. You deserve a prize for being the last person on livejournal, too. Bravo! I hope your "o'ten" can outdo your "o'nine" my good man. Here's to the new year. P.S. I made a prediction the other day with Trav and Steve. They heard me "call it"... it's going to be Undertaker/Michaels at WM26.... with a special guest referee of Bret Hart. So, yeah, 2010 is going to be real good to you so far, if this comes true.

comments.author: Wendy Busanich
comments.text: Thank you for tagging me and letting me read about your fabulous year. I hope 2010 is just as amazing for you :) Your year gives me hope that maybe i can i have a year as great as yours.

comments.author: Prof. Beric
comments.text: Dear John, Thanks for sharing the Journal with me. It is a great way to preserve time and memories, people and events... I am glad that I am a part of your good year and I celebrate your successes! Have a great year ahead, happy and healthy, prosperous new 2010 to you and your family! Sincerely, Prof. Beric
